channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: LIVE updates: COVID-19 and extended quarantine in the Philippines
item.author: PhilstarLIVE
item.description: The latest updates on the spread of the novel coronavirus in the Philippines and enhanced community quarantine of economic center of Metro Manila and other areas across the country.

item.title: Fewer Pinoys testing positive for COVID
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: While cases of the coronavirus disease 2019 have reached 10,794, the Department of Health says fewer Filipinos are now testing positive for the infection.

item.title: ABS-CBN optimistic on franchise renewal
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: ABS-CBN Corp. expressed optimism that Congress would immediately act on its franchise renewal after it was told to shut down last week.

item.title: Rice prices going up, traders say
item.author: Ramon Efren Lazaro
item.description: As the summer palay harvest season draws to a close and the lean rice months are fast approaching, prices of the country’s staple grain have started to rise.

item.title: Hagibis’ Sonny Parsons dies of heart attack
item.author: Arnell Ozaeta
item.description: Former Hagibis band member Sonny Parsons died of a heart attack while riding a motorcycle in Lemery, Batangas, at past noon yesterday. He was 61.

item.title: DSWD: Displaced OFWs’ families among SAP’s target beneficiaries
item.description: Families of overseas Filipinos in distress are among the target beneficiaries of the government Social Amelioration Program , the Department of Social Welfare and Development reiterated yesterday.

item.title: DOST looking into anti-viral properties of lagundi, tawa-tawa
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: Aside from virgin coconut oil, the Department of Science and Technology will fund the research and development for the recognition and approval of lagundi and tawa-tawa as potential treatments for the coronavirus disease 2019, Secretary Fortunato dela Peña revealed.

item.title: DepEd may set new school opening protocols
item.description: The Department of Education may implement new guidelines on the opening of classes if Metro Manila and other high-risk areas remain under enhanced community quarantine during the start of the school year.

item.title: Higher ECQ power demand, summer heat cause outages
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Manila Electric Co.is facing unprecedented power interruption woes as Metro Manila and nearby provinces undergo strict quarantine measures to fight the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: BI: Flight restrictions remain
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: The Bureau of Immigration yesterday reminded the public that travel restrictions would still apply even if inbound charter and commercial flights resume today at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport.
